refsect1.title: DESCRIPTION
refsect1.para: ctdb_etcd_lock is intended to be run as a mutex helper for CTDB. It will try to connect to an existing etcd cluster and grab a lock in that cluster to function as CTDB's recovery lock. Please see ctdb/doc/cluster_mutex_helper.txt for details on the mutex helper API. To use this, include the following line in the [cluster] section of ctdb.conf 5:
You can also pass "-v", "-vv", or "-vvv" to include verbose output in the CTDB log. Additional "v"s indicate increases in verbosity.

This mutex helper expects the system Python interpreter to have access to the etcd Python module. It also expects an etcd cluster to be configured and running. To integrate with this, there is an optional config file of the following format:
The following configuration parameters (and their defaults) are defined for use by ctdb_etcd_lock:
refsect1.screen: port = 2379 # connecting port for the etcd cluster lock_ttl = 9 # seconds for TTL refresh = 2 # seconds between attempts to maintain lock locks_dir = _ctdb # where to store CTDB locks in etcd # The final etcd directory for any given lock looks like: # /_locks/{locks_dir}/{netbios name}/
refsect1.para: In addition, any keyword parameter that can be used to configure an etcd client may be specified and modified here. For more documentation on these parameters, see here: https://github.com/jplana/python-etcd/
